messages.body:
Hey there!

You're using a mostly-featured yet minimal web-based mail user agent prototype (weighing in at just ~40 kB gzipped including all HTML, JavaScript and SVG). It does provide many features you'd expect from a modern web-based mail app:

  • Fully responsive design (no seperate mobile frontend!)
  • WYSIWYG editor
  • Drag and drop
  • Drop-down menus
  • Modal windows
  • Notifications
  • Search, Sorting
  • Deep links
  • Service worker w/ asset caching
  • Workers / multi-threading
  • Global state via proxies & events (use the platform!)
  • Loading states

Other features of this particular demo:

  • Random message generator
  • Fake network latency
  • Hosted on IPFS (via fleek.co)

The project has just two external dependencies, Preact and Twind. These are not essential but provide for very nice maintainability and developer experience, adding just a few extra kB.

Have fun playing around!

— Christian (MUNDPROPAGANDA.net)
messages.subject: Welcome to the Webmail Demo!

messages.body:
Travel was once a means of being elsewhere, or of being nowhere. Today it is the only way we have of feeling that we are somewhere. At home, surrounded by information, by screens, I am no longer anywhere, but rather everywhere in the world at once, in the midst of a universal banality - a banality that is the same in every country. To arrive in a new city, or in a new language, is suddenly to find oneself here and nowhere else. The body rediscovers how to look. Delivered from images, it rediscovers the imagination.

— Jean
